children.subject: To clarify, I took CS70 as L&S CS over the summer with an R&C B requirement course, and it was pretty intense with PSETs+exams with lots of reading and writing along with it (though it may have just been the particular R&CB I took). I'd imagine it would be even heavier with the combo you described.

Thank you for replying to this post! It looks like I'll have to look for another requirement to fulfill/ either the Natural Sciences requirement or the Ethics requirement. I could also just enroll in CS61C alone and just focus on that.

That's definitely a much safer choice! Didnt mean to dissuade you or anything, its just summer courses can be overwhelming, and I've seen one of my friends take 61C by itself with a part time job, and they dropped the course bc it was getting too difficult with the projects+tests+homeworks and whatnot. They could have been doing a side project/traveling/getting much-needed rest after Spring term :( 169+^61C is doable but unfortunately doable is a relative term and it doesn't necessarily precede enjoyable/worthwhile... you have some time to sleep on it though before enrollment starts!
Enrollment for fall that is*** since it may influence your decision

Yeah, so long as you don't plan on doing anything else (e.g. working research etc.). Keep in mind it will be roughly like having 14 units of techs during the regular semester. Though, it's probably easier to do 61C and some other requirement you might have--a breadth or something else you need to get out of the way. Both classes are project-based, so you might want to expect some moments of serious crunch time/stress if you don't have very good discipline and pacing. You may feel very burned out after the summer is over, as I did when I took two summer courses, and that wont be fun since you have to start another whole school year right afterward. Best of luck!

history.content:
I plan on pairing CS61C with  cs169 this summer. Thoughts on this schedule? Is it doable? For context, 169
is being offered online and it's worth 3 units over the summer.
history.subject: 169 Paired with CS61C
